info.title: AU Core Responder CapabilityStatement
info.description: This CapabilityStatement describes the basic rules for the [AU Core Responder actor](ActorDefinition-au-core-actor-responder.html) that is responsible for providing responses to queries submitted by AU Core Requesters. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by AU Core Responders are defined in this CapabilityStatement.

/metadata.summary: Access to the Server's Capability Statement
/metadata.description: All FHIR Servers return a CapabilityStatement that describes what services they perform

get.summary: Return the server's capability statement

/AllergyIntolerance.summary: Manager for resources of type AllergyIntolerance
/AllergyIntolerance.description: The Manager for resources of type AllergyIntolerance: provides services to manage the collection of all the AllergyIntolerance instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type AllergyIntolerance based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: active | inactive | resolved

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:
A clinical patient **SHOULD** support patient.identifier. This AU Core SearchParameter extends the usage context of the
clinical-patient parameter
 - multipleAnd
 - multipleOr
 - chain

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type AllergyIntolerance
/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type AllergyIntolerance

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

put.summary: Update the current state of the resource

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

patch.summary: Change the current state of the resource by providing a patch - a series of change commands

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being patched

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

delete.summary: Delete the resource so that it no exists (no read, search etc)

204.description: If the resource is deleted - no content is returned

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}/_history.summary: Read past versions of resource instance of type AllergyIntolerance
/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}/_history.description: Access to previous versions of a single resource of type AllergyIntolerance

get.summary: Read the past states of the resource

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time

parameters.name: _at
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were current at some point during the time period specified in the date time value (see Search notes on date searching)

parameters.name: _list
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that are referenced in the specified list (current list references are allowed)

/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}/_history/{hid}.summary: Read a past version of resource instance of type AllergyIntolerance
/AllergyIntolerance/{rid}/_history/{hid}.description: Access a to specified previous version of a single resource of type AllergyIntolerance

get.summary: Read a past state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag for that version

/Condition.summary: Manager for resources of type Condition
/Condition.description: The Manager for resources of type Condition: provides services to manage the collection of all the Condition instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Condition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the condition

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: The clinical status of the condition

parameters.name: code
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance
* [Condition](condition.html): Code for the condition
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Code for what is being requested/ordered
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The code for the report, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): A search by a condition code
* [List](list.html): What the purpose of this list is
* [Medication](medication.html): Returns medications for a specific code
* [MedicationAdministration](medicationadministration.html): Return administrations of this medication code
* [MedicationDispense](medicationdispense.html): Returns dispenses of this medicine code
* [MedicationRequest](medicationrequest.html): Return prescriptions of this medication code
* [MedicationStatement](medicationstatement.html): Return statements of this medication code
* [Observation](observation.html): The code of the observation type
* [Procedure](procedure.html): A code to identify a  procedure
* [ServiceRequest](servicerequest.html): What is being requested/ordered

parameters.name: onset-date
parameters.description: Date related onsets (dateTime and Period)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:
A clinical patient **SHOULD** support patient.identifier. This AU Core SearchParameter extends the usage context of the
clinical-patient parameter
 - multipleAnd
 - multipleOr
 - chain

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Encounter.summary: Manager for resources of type Encounter
/Encounter.description: The Manager for resources of type Encounter: provides services to manage the collection of all the Encounter instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Encounter based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Classification of patient encounter

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Date first version of the resource instance was recorded
* [CarePlan](careplan.html): Time period plan covers
* [CareTeam](careteam.html): Time period team covers
* [ClinicalImpression](clinicalimpression.html): When the assessment was documented
* [Composition](composition.html): Composition editing time
* [Consent](consent.html): When this Consent was created or indexed
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The clinically relevant time of the report
* [Encounter](encounter.html): A date within the period the Encounter lasted
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): The provided date search value falls within the episode of care's period
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): When history was recorded or last updated
* [Flag](flag.html): Time period when flag is active
* [Immunization](immunization.html): Vaccination  (non)-Administration Date
* [List](list.html): When the list was prepared
* [Observation](observation.html): Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period
* [Procedure](procedure.html): When the procedure was performed
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): When was assessment made?
* [SupplyRequest](supplyrequest.html): When the request was made

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location the encounter takes place

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:
A clinical patient **SHOULD** support patient.identifier. This AU Core SearchParameter extends the usage context of the
clinical-patient parameter
 - multipleAnd
 - multipleOr
 - chain

parameters.description: Logical id of this artifact

parameters.name: authoredon
parameters.description: Return prescriptions written on this date

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: Returns prescriptions with different intents

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [MedicationAdministration](medicationadministration.html): MedicationAdministration event status (for example one of active/paused/completed/nullified)
* [MedicationDispense](medicationdispense.html): Returns dispenses with a specified dispense status
* [MedicationRequest](medicationrequest.html): Status of the prescription
* [MedicationStatement](medicationstatement.html): Return statements that match the given status

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:

clinical-patient parameter

 - chain

* [Person](person.html): The gender of the person
* [Practitioner](practitioner.html): Gender of the practitioner
* [RelatedPerson](relatedperson.html): Gender of the related person

/Procedure.summary: Manager for resources of type Procedure
/Procedure.description: The Manager for resources of type Procedure: provides services to manage the collection of all the Procedure instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Procedure based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: code
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance
* [Condition](condition.html): Code for the condition
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Code for what is being requested/ordered
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The code for the report, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): A search by a condition code
* [List](list.html): What the purpose of this list is
* [Medication](medication.html): Returns medications for a specific code
* [MedicationAdministration](medicationadministration.html): Return administrations of this medication code
* [MedicationDispense](medicationdispense.html): Returns dispenses of this medicine code
* [MedicationRequest](medicationrequest.html): Return prescriptions of this medication code
* [MedicationStatement](medicationstatement.html): Return statements of this medication code
* [Observation](observation.html): The code of the observation type
* [Procedure](procedure.html): A code to identify a  procedure
* [ServiceRequest](servicerequest.html): What is being requested/ordered

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Date first version of the resource instance was recorded
* [CarePlan](careplan.html): Time period plan covers
* [CareTeam](careteam.html): Time period team covers
* [ClinicalImpression](clinicalimpression.html): When the assessment was documented
* [Composition](composition.html): Composition editing time
* [Consent](consent.html): When this Consent was created or indexed
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The clinically relevant time of the report
* [Encounter](encounter.html): A date within the period the Encounter lasted
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): The provided date search value falls within the episode of care's period
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): When history was recorded or last updated
* [Flag](flag.html): Time period when flag is active
* [Immunization](immunization.html): Vaccination  (non)-Administration Date
* [List](list.html): When the list was prepared
* [Observation](observation.html): Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period
* [Procedure](procedure.html): When the procedure was performed
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): When was assessment made?
* [SupplyRequest](supplyrequest.html): When the request was made

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: preparation | in-progress | not-done | on-hold | stopped | completed | entered-in-error | unknown

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:
A clinical patient **SHOULD** support patient.identifier. This AU Core SearchParameter extends the usage context of the
clinical-patient parameter
 - multipleAnd
 - multipleOr
 - chain

requestBody.description: The batch or transaction

summary.name: _summary
summary.description: Requests the server to return a designated subset of the resource

format.name: _format
format.description: Specify alternative response formats by their MIME-types (when a client is unable acccess accept: header)

pretty.name: _pretty
pretty.description: Ask for a pretty printed response for human convenience

elements.name: _elements
elements.description: Requests the server to return a collection of elements from the resource

count.name: _count
count.description: The maximum number of search results on a page. The server is not bound to return the number requested, but cannot return more
